turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Hylogenesis.
turn.1: What is known about the structure of the early universe?
turn.2: Hylogenesis Hylogenesis is a physical theory about the mechanism behind the origins of dark matter and antimatter.
turn.4: It was proposed in August 2010 in a paper by Hooman Davoudiasl, David E. Morrissey, Kris Sigurdson and Sean Tulin.
turn.5: What are the particles involved in the theory?
turn.6: The theory involves a fermion X, and its antiparticle , both of which may couple into quarks in the visible sector, and into hidden particles in a hidden sector, a sector which is not part of the Standard Model.
turn.8: The hidden states have masses near a GeV and very weak couplings to particles in the Standard Model.
turn.9: What else is significant about this theory?
turn.10: X and respectively decay into either baryonic matter or hidden baryonic matter, and into either antibaryonic matter or hidden antibaryonic matter, violating CP and quark baryon number.
turn.11: Is there anything else that is notable?
turn.12: An excess of baryonic matter is created in the visible sector, and an excess of antimatter is created in the hidden sector.
